title: The Best College in Every State, Where You Get Bang for Your Buck
text:
The Best College in Every State, Where You Get Bang for Your Buck Written by: Laurie Kulikowski 10/10/15 - 8:53 AM EDT 
NEW YORK (TheStreet) -- Making a smart decision about where to go to college has never been more important, considering the surging expenses to continue studies post-high school make it almost impossible to attend a four-year school without student loans. With student loan debt exceeding $1 trillion in the U.S., equally as important as finding a school that's affordable is finding one where the earnings associated with the school's degree are significant enough to outweigh the costs of going there. 
PayScale , an online salary, benefits and compensation company, culled its 2015-2016 College Salary Report , released in August, for TheStreet, to find the college in each of the 50 states where the "return on investment" after 20 years was the highest. 
So what does it really mean? Some schools are "simply doing a better job of setting their alumni up for success in the job market ," PayScale said. "Whether you're planning to study computer science or psychology, earning potential in your chosen field, along with the cost of attendance for the schools you're considering, should be part of the equation when whittling down your list of best return on investment colleges."
